AudioProcessingEventOutputBuffer.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The outputBuffer read-only property of the interface represents the output buffer of an audio processing event.

remarks.para: The output buffer is represented by an object, which contains a collection of audio channels, each of which is an array of floating-point values representing the audio signal waveform encoded as a series of amplitudes. The number of channels and the length of each channel are determined by the channel count and buffer size properties of the AudioBuffer.
